SubTopics: Explain the importance of the Malian king Mansa Musa and his pilgrimage to Mecca in 1324.
Content: Read the source and answer the question.

:box:This man [Mansa Musa] flooded Cairo with his benefactions [gifts]. He left no court emir [leader] nor holder of a royal office without the gift of a load of gold. The Cairenes [residents of Cairo] made incalculable profits out of him and his suite in buying and selling and giving and taking. They exchanged gold until they depressed its value in Egypt and caused its price to fall.

	— An account by an Arab historian about Mansa Musa in 1324
Which statement explains the effect of Mansa Musa's journey to Egypt?

A.Choice: His purchases decreased demand for local goods.

B.Choice: His caravan introduced new political ideas.

C.Choice: His wealth overwhelmed the local economy.

D.Choice: His caravan created new enemies in the region.

SubTopics: Describe Kublai Khan's conquest of China, and explain how he was able to maintain control of the Yuan Empire.
Content: Look at the source and answer the question.
Which TWO statements correctly describe this empire?

A.Choice: It reached the height of its power under Mehmed II.

B.Choice: It peacefully expanded into European territories.

C.Choice: It conducted the first trade along the Silk Road.

D.Choice: It established the Yuan Dynasty in China.

E.Choice: It conquered southern China under Kublai Khan.

F.Choice: It moved its capital to the city of Moscow.

SubTopics: Analyze the rise of a military society in the late 12th century and the role of the shogun and samurai in Japanese society.
Content: Which THREE factors contributed to Japan becoming a military society in the late twelfth century?

A.Choice: Shoguns gave land or income to samurai in exchange for military service.

B.Choice: Shoguns helped resolve conflicts among clans.

C.Choice: Shoguns had increased military support from the peasant farmers.

D.Choice: Samurai encouraged economic growth throughout the empire.

E.Choice: Samurai were trained to reach agreements with foreign representatives.

F.Choice: Samurai owed loyalty to the shogun rather than the emperor.

SubTopics: Analyze Johannes Gutenberg's printing press and William Tyndale's translation of the Bible into the English language as vehicles for the spread of books, growth of literacy, and dissemination of knowledge.
Content: Which THREE statements describe MAJO results from the work of Johannes Gutenberg?

A.Choice: The power of the Catholic Church increased across Europe.

B.Choice: The use of vernacular languages in texts increased.

C.Choice: The education of the lower classes became a priority throughout Europe.

D.Choice: The ideas of the Renaissance spread more quickly throughout Europe.

E.Choice: The people were able to make their own conclusions about religious texts.

F.Choice: The differences between social classes decreased.

SubTopics: Identify the significance of the voyages and routes of discovery of the following explorers by their sponsoring country.
Content: Look at the source and answer the question.
Which TWO explorers' routes are shown on this source?

Topics: Middle Ages In Western Europe (400-1500s CE)
SubTopics: Describe how political relationships both fostered cooperation and led to conflict between the Papacy and European monarchs.
Content: Read the source and answer the question.

:box:Pope Gregory VII and Emperor Henry IV Disagreed On:

• whether or not the emperor had the right to appoint the bishops, and
• whether the pope or the nobles had the right to appoint local church officials and bishops
The relationship described in this source represented

A.Choice: the development of a movement to reform the government.

B.Choice: a struggle between religious and government authorities.

C.Choice: the development of a papal bureaucracy.

D.Choice: an alliance to conquer and convert barbarian tribes.

SubTopics: Describe how the Heian aristocracy contributed to the development of a Japanese national culture.
Content: Read the source and answer the question.

:box:• The capital was established at Kyoto and remained there for 1,000 years.

• Buddhism spread throughout the country.

• Official ties with China were greatly reduced.
Which time period is represented by these events?

A.Choice: the expansion of the empire during the Mughal period

B.Choice: the dominance of the Khan dynasty during the Yuan period

C.Choice: the rise of the nation of Japan during the Heian period

D.Choice: the advances in technology under the Song dynasties
